com.android.future.usb

Class UsbManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.future.usb.UsbManager

  • public class UsbManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a wrapper class for the USB Manager to support USB accessories.

    You can obtain an instance of this class by calling getInstance(android.content.Context)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_ATTACHED
      Broadcast Action: A broadcast for USB accessory attached event.
      static java.lang.String ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_DETACHED
      Broadcast Action: A broadcast for USB accessory detached event.
      static java.lang.String EXTRA_PERMISSION_GRANTED
      Name of extra added to the PendingIntent passed into {#requestPermission} or {#requestPermission} containing a boolean value indicating whether the user granted permission or not.

    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_ATTACHED

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_ATTACHED
        Broadcast Action: A broadcast for USB accessory attached event. This intent is sent when a USB accessory is attached. Call getAccessory(android.content.Intent) to retrieve the com.google.android.usb.UsbAccessory for the attached accessory.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_DETACHED

        public static final java.lang.String ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_DETACHED
        Broadcast Action: A broadcast for USB accessory detached event. This intent is sent when a USB accessory is detached. Call getAccessory(android.content.Intent) to retrieve the com.google.android.usb.UsbAccessory for the attached accessory that was detached.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_PERMISSION_GRANTED

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_PERMISSION_GRANTED
        Name of extra added to the PendingIntent passed into {#requestPermission} or {#requestPermission} containing a boolean value indicating whether the user granted permission or not.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UsbManager getInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Returns a new instance of this class.
        Parameters:
        context - the caller's Context
        Returns:
        UsbManager instance.

      • getAccessory

        public static UsbAccessory getAccessory(android.content.Intent intent)
        Returns the com.google.android.usb.UsbAccessory for a ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_ATTACHED or ACTION_USB_ACCESSORY_ATTACHED broadcast Intent. This can also be used to retrieve the accessory from the result of a call to {#requestPermission}.
        Returns:
        UsbAccessory for the intent.

      • getAccessoryList

        public UsbAccessory[] getAccessoryList()
        Returns a list of currently attached USB accessories. (in the current implementation there can be at most one)
        Returns:
        list of USB accessories, or null if none are attached.

      • openAccessory

        public android.os.ParcelFileDescriptor openAccessory(UsbAccessory accessory)
        Opens a file descriptor for reading and writing data to the USB accessory.
        Parameters:
        accessory - the USB accessory to open
        Returns:
        file descriptor, or null if the accessor could not be opened.

      • hasPermission

        public boolean hasPermission(UsbAccessory accessory)
        Returns true if the caller has permission to access the accessory. Permission might have been granted temporarily via requestPermission(com.android.future.usb.UsbAccessory, android.app.PendingIntent) or by the user choosing the caller as the default application for the accessory.
        Parameters:
        accessory - to check permissions for
        Returns:
        true if caller has permission

      • requestPermission

        public void requestPermission(UsbAccessory accessory,
                              android.app.PendingIntent pi)
        Requests temporary permission for the given package to access the accessory. This may result in a system dialog being displayed to the user if permission had not already been granted. Success or failure is returned via the PendingIntent pi. The boolean extra EXTRA_PERMISSION_GRANTED will be attached to the PendingIntent to indicate success or failure. If successful, this grants the caller permission to access the device only until the device is disconnected.
        Parameters:
        accessory - to request permissions for
        pi - PendingIntent for returning result
